skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill containing only documentation and communication templates. No code execution, external connections, or security risks detected.

content.value_statement: Streamlines internal company communications by providing proven templates for 3P updates, newsletters, FAQs, and other common formats that executives and teams actually read.
actual_capabilities: Write 3P (Progress, Plans, Problems) team updates in executive-friendly format
Generate company-wide newsletters with structured sections and links
Create FAQ answers based on common employee questions
Draft status reports and leadership updates
Format communications for Slack, email, and document distribution
Integrate data from Slack, Google Drive, email, and calendar when available
limitations: Requires user to provide content or access to communication tools (Slack, email, etc.)
Cannot automatically access company systems without MCP integration
Templates are opinionated and may not match all company cultures
Best suited for tech companies with similar communication patterns

use_cases.title: Weekly Team 3P Update
use_cases.description: Generate a concise Progress/Plans/Problems update that executives can read in 30-60 seconds, pulling from Slack messages, recent docs, and team activity
use_cases.target_user: Engineering managers, product leads, and team leads who need to report weekly progress

use_cases.title: Company Newsletter
use_cases.description: Compile a company-wide update with 20-25 bullet points covering announcements, milestones, and achievements from across the organization
use_cases.target_user: Internal communications managers, executive assistants, and leadership teams

use_cases.title: Employee FAQ Compilation
use_cases.description: Identify common questions being asked across company channels and provide clear, sourced answers to reduce confusion
use_cases.target_user: HR teams, people ops, and internal communications specialists

use_cases.title: Incident Report Communication
use_cases.description: Draft clear, professional incident reports and status updates for internal stakeholders
use_cases.target_user: Engineering leads, SREs, and incident commanders

prompt_templates.title: Weekly 3P Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the [team name] team covering [date range]. Here's what we did this week: [accomplishments]. Our plans for next week: [upcoming work]. Current blockers: [problems].
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to send a quick weekly update to leadership about your team's progress

prompt_templates.title: Monthly Newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a company newsletter for [month]. Include these highlights: [list key events, launches, hires, announcements]. Use a professional but approachable tone.
prompt_templates.scenario: When compiling a monthly all-hands update for the entire company

prompt_templates.title: FAQ Answer
prompt_templates.prompt: I've been seeing questions about [topic] across Slack. Can you help me write an FAQ entry? The common question is: [question]. Here's the context: [background info].
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to clarify a common point of confusion for employees

best_practices: Always confirm team name and time period before drafting updates
Use data and metrics wherever possible to make updates concrete
Keep 3P updates to 30-60 seconds reading time (1-3 sentences per section)
Link to relevant docs, Slack threads, and announcements in newsletters
Focus on company-wide impact for newsletters, not team-specific minutiae
Match the existing communication style and tone of the company
Pull from multiple sources (Slack, email, calendar, docs) when available
anti_patterns: Writing overly verbose updates that executives won't read
Including team-specific jargon in company-wide communications
Forgetting to ask for team name or time period upfront
Using flowery prose instead of clear, data-driven statements
Mixing formatting styles or breaking from the prescribed templates
Including information only relevant to small subgroups in company newsletters

faq.question: What does 3P stand for?
faq.answer: 3P stands for Progress, Plans, and Problems - a concise format for team updates focused on what was accomplished, what's next, and what's blocking progress.

faq.question: Can I customize the templates for my company?
faq.answer: Yes, while the skill provides opinionated templates, you can modify the examples files or provide specific formatting requirements when asking Claude to generate communications.

faq.question: Do I need to connect my Slack/email for this to work?
faq.answer: No, the skill works with or without tool access. If you have MCP integrations for Slack, Google Drive, etc., Claude can pull information automatically. Otherwise, you provide the content and Claude formats it properly.

faq.question: Is this only for tech companies?
faq.answer: While the templates are optimized for tech company communication patterns (engineering teams, product launches, etc.), the formats work for any organization that values concise, data-driven updates.
